message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY 

The paper discusses contextual information retrieval (CIR) techniques for search engines, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR) in computer science. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of shared knowledge bases and user behavior, which are related to natural language processing (NLP) and artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.CL and cs.AI likely sub-categories as well. The use of preferences and behavior also suggests machine learning (ML) and data mining (DM) techniques, making cs.LG a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the importance of capturing and representing contextual information, which is related to cybersecurity (cs.CY) as well.
